intro: Acritopappus harleyi, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with small, hairy leaves that reduce water loss. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in desert and semi-desert habitats.
